column1: Sleeping sickness is an infection caused by germs carried by certain flies.
It results in swelling of the brain.

General symptoms include: - Anxiety - Mood changes - Fever - Headache - Weakness - Insomnia at night - Sleepiness during the day (may be uncontrollable) - Sweating - Swollen lymph nodes all over the body - Swollen, red, painful nodule at site of the fly bite
A physical exam may show inflammation of the brain and its covering.

Medicines used to treat this disorder include: - Eflornithine (for T. b. gambiense only) - Melarsoprol - Pentamidine (for T. b. gambiense only) - Suramin (Antrypol) Some people may receive a combination of these medicines.
Pentamidine injections protect against T. b. gambiense, but not against T. b. rhodesiense.
Because this medicine is toxic, using it for prevention is not recommended.
